description: Special Contract Rates
notes: Service Classification No. 12 provides discounted rates and special contract arrangements for qualifying non-residential customers who meet eligibility criteria. Rates are negotiated individually or based on standardized discounts from standard tariff rates SC-2D, SC-3, SC-3A, SC-4, and SC-7. This tariff does not specify explicit rate components or charges; rather, it references eligibility and discount programs and requires execution of Customer Service Agreements. Minimum bill provisions apply but are not quantified here.

logic_steps.value: Rates are based on or discounted from standard tariff rates SC-2D, SC-3, SC-3A, SC-4, and SC-7
Minimum amount due regardless of consumption as per contract

logic_steps.step_name: Demand Charge - Minimum Demand (first 40 kW or less)
logic_steps.applicability: applied to first 40 kW or less of billed demand
applied to billed demand over 40 kW

logic_steps.condition: Reactive demand applies when demand exceeds 500 kW under specified conditions

notes: Demand is determined per voltage level as highest 15-minute kW interval with minimums as specified.
Reactive demand is calculated as highest lagging reactive kVA minus one-third of highest kW demand.
Special Provisions L and N require interval meters and add a $25.10/month incremental customer charge for hourly pricing customers.
Electricity Supply Service charges are billed separately per Rule 46 and are not included here.
Minimum monthly charge is the sum of the above charges computed per demand and customer charge rules.
No energy (per kWh) delivery charge is specified in this tariff text for SC3.

description: Untransformed Service to Certain Customers Taking Power from Projects of the New York Power Authority
notes: SC4 Supplemental Service rates, terms and conditions are those of the applicable parent service classification (SC3 or SC3A) except as modified herein. This document defines billing quantity determinations and adjustments for Niagara Power Delivery Service, HLF Delivery Service, Preservation Power Delivery Service, and SC-4 Supplemental Service. No explicit rate charges (customer, energy, demand, reactive) are defined here; rates are as per parent classifications.

logic_steps.description: Calendar month billing period applies to Niagara Power Delivery Service, HLF Delivery Service, Preservation Power Delivery Service, and SC-4 Supplemental Service.

Billed demand and energy for Niagara Power Delivery Service, HLF Delivery Service, Preservation Power Delivery Service, and SC-4 Supplemental Service are calculated based on metered values adjusted by contract demands, allocation agreements, and loss adjustments as specified in the tariff text and Rule 39.18. Specific formulas vary by service type and effective date.

logic_steps.logic: Billed demand is the greatest of: (1) the amount by which the overall maximum 30-minute integrated demand exceeds the sum of demands for Niagara Power Delivery Service, Preservation Power Delivery Service, HLF Delivery Service, and EDP/PFJ Power; (2) the contracted SC-4 Supplemental Service demand; or (3) the minimum demand provisions of the parent service classification.

Billed kWh is the amount by which total metered kWh at delivery voltage exceeds the sum of kWh from Niagara Power Delivery Service, Preservation Power Delivery Service, HLF Delivery Service, and EDP/PFJR Service, with the proviso that the sum of these sources does not exceed total metered kWh.
Reactive Demand is the highest average RkVA of lagging reactive demand over a 30-minute interval during the month less one-third of the highest kW demand measured during the month.

logic_steps.description: Customers under SC4 are eligible for EV Phase-In Rates as described in Rules 48.2.8, 48.2.9, and 48.2.11, applied to total load inclusive of NYPA deliveries.

reference: Rates, terms, and conditions for SC-4 Supplemental Service are those of the applicable parent service classification (SC3 or SC3A) except as modified herein.

description: Combined 25 and 60 Hertz Service
note: Service Classification No. 5 is canceled. No active tariff logic to extract.

description: Purchase of Electric Energy and Capacity from Customers with Qualifying On-Site Generation Facilities

logic_steps.notes: Real Time LBMP in $/MWh; Q_i is energy delivered in kWh per hour; Incurred Cost includes penalties assessed by NYISO
Capacity is Unforced Capacity recognized by NYISO or 5000 kW limit for contracts on or after July 1, 2019
Rate to be paid shall be no less than 6.0 cents per kWh, averaged annually and trued-up monthly
For qualifying small random suppliers electing non-time differentiated basis; customer pays installed cost of metering equipment instead of Metering, Minimum, and Distribution Demand Charges
Customer Charge waived under SC-6 if service is taken under both SC-6 and another service classification through same connection
Based on customer's otherwise applicable service classification for delivery service; applies only to Buyback Contract Demand in excess of Contract Demand billed under other service classification

notes: Energy payment is based on Real Time LBMP times energy delivered minus incurred costs.
Capacity payment is based on LBMCP times capacity with a 5000 kW limit for contracts after July 1, 2019.
Customer Charge and Buyback Contract Demand Charge are based on customer's otherwise applicable service classification.
Buyback Contract Demand is defined by customer's contract demand or higher maximum demand recorded.
No direct fixed customer charge or energy charge is specified under SC-6 except as Buyback Contract Demand Charge and Customer Charge tied to other service classifications.
Reactive or RKVA charges are not specified.
